getMediaArt().Description: Returns a bitmap of the art for the media item.

Parameters: int: The desired playback speed. For normal playback this will be @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackControlGlue#PLAYBACK_SPEED_NORMAL_E@; higher positive values for fast forward, and negative values for rewind.
startPlayback(int).Description: use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackControlGlue#play_E@ instead. Start playback at the given speed.

skipToPrevious().Description: use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackControlGlue#previous_E@ instead. Skip to the previous track.

skipToNext().Description: use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackControlGlue#next_E@ instead. Skip to the next track.

getCurrentPosition().Description: Returns the current position of the media item in milliseconds.

getMediaSubtitle().Description: Returns the subtitle of the media item.

getSupportedActions().Description: Returns a bitmask of actions supported by the media player.

attachToMediaController(android.support..Description: Attaches to the given media controller.

getMediaTitle().Description: Returns the title of the media item.

Parameters: int: Array of seek speeds for fast forward.
int: Array of seek speeds for rewind.
MediaControllerGlue(android.content.Cont.Description: Constructor for the glue. The @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackOverlayFragment_E@ must be passed in. A @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#OnItemViewClickedListener_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackControlGlue#InputEventHandler_E@ will be set on the fragment.
MediaControllerGlue(android.content.Cont.FullName: MediaControllerGlue (Context context, PlaybackOverlayFragment fragment, int[] fastForwardSpeeds, int[] rewindSpeeds)

hasValidMedia().Description: Returns true if there is a valid media item.

getCurrentSpeedId().Description: Returns the current playback speed. When playing normally, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackControlGlue#PLAYBACK_SPEED_NORMAL_E@ should be returned.

isMediaPlaying().Description: Returns true if media is currently playing.

getMediaDuration().Description: Returns the duration of the media item in milliseconds.

getMediaController().Description: Returns the media controller currently attached.

detach().Description: Detaches from the media controller. Must be called when the object is no longer needed.

Parameters: int: Array of seek speeds for fast forward and rewind.
MediaControllerGlue(android.content.Cont.Description: Constructor for the glue. The @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackOverlayFragment_E@ must be passed in. A @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#OnItemViewClickedListener_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackControlGlue#InputEventHandler_E@ will be set on the fragment.
MediaControllerGlue(android.content.Cont.FullName: MediaControllerGlue (Context context, PlaybackOverlayFragment fragment, int[] seekSpeeds)

ClassDesc: Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#MediaControllerGlue_E@. A helper class for implementing a glue layer between a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#PlaybackOverlayFragment_E@ and a @B_android#support#v4#media#session#MediaControllerCompat_E@.
